metadata.Title: CVE-2012-0799 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Moodle 2.0.x before 2.0.7 and 2.1.x before 2.1.4, when an anonymous front-page forum is enabled, allows remote attackers to obtain session keys for their sessions by visiting the front page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-0799` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

moodle - 2.2.2.dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: moodle package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.2.dfsg-2').
